ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS England South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS England South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit

TITLE.P: South, Central and West CSU: General Practice IT Support Services — Market Engagement

SHORT_DESCR.P: South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit currently provides a range of IT and system support services to 21 customer CCGs across the South of England and is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced providers of IT support services to work with us to support our customers.
The service will provide 3rd Party IT Support delivering Primary Care GP IT services to over 500 GP Practices in accordance with the revised GP IT operating model.
The contract is due to commence 1.4.2019 and is anticipated to run for 3 to 5 years.

MAIN_SITE.P: Services to be provided to over 1 000 GP practices across the South of England.

SHORT_DESCR.P: South, Central and West Commissioning Support Unit currently provides a range of IT and system support services to 22 customer CCGs across the South of England and is seeking expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced providers of IT support services to work with us to support our customers.

The service will provide 3rd Party IT Support delivering Primary Care GP IT services to over 500 GP Practices in accordance with the revised GP IT operating model — “Securing Excellence in GP IT Services Operating Model 2016 – 18”.

This revised GP IT operating model includes expanded core and mandated GP IT requirements – making it clear what general practice should be able to expect from IT service delivery arrangements, together with driving digital adoption through maturity assurance, providing a new maturity assurance framework to assess progress towards digital adoption – the Digital Primary Care Maturity Assurance model and sets out how we will achieve world class digital primary care systems that provide flexible, responsive and integrated services for patients, giving them greater control over their health and care.
The service provider may be expected to provide a flexible level of service tailored to individual CCGs and will include ad-hoc implementation of practice moves and upgrades.
This notice is placed in order to facilitate early engagement with potential providers, and relates only to a pre-procurement market engagement event.
Prospective bidders and interested organisations are warmly invited to a pre-procurement market engagement event being held on 25.4.2018 in Reading.

We would welcome attendance from those organisations who may be interested in bidding for these services, either in their own right or as a subcontractor. It will be an opportunity to meet with the Commissioners, hear more about the services and the customers we serve and discuss the critical issues, challenges and opportunities that relate to commissioning and provision of this service.

Commissioners will provide an indication of future contracting intentions for GP IT Support services across the South of England. At the meeting we will also provide information about the procurement process, which is being designed to be proportionate, transparent, equitable and effective. There will also be an opportunity for potential lead providers to engage with other providers who may be interested in joining forces or subcontracting.

The aim of the event is to work with potential bidders and stakeholders to understand opportunities and barriers to providing these services and the Commissioners welcome input from bidders as an opportunity to share best practice and innovation on the day.

If you would like to book a place, please register an expression of interest on the In-Tend e-procurement portal, as well as completing the Event Registration Questionnaire, by 12:00 midday on 16.4.2018, stating your organisation along with the names and titles of those wishing to attend.
In order to establish fair representation, availability for this event is limited to a maximum of 2 individuals per organisation.
Venue details and further information will be provided to interested parties on receipt of booking details.

INFO_ADD.P: This notice is an information gathering exercise rather than a call for competition in its own right, and therefore publication or response does not commit the commissioner(s) to a future procurement, nor provide any process exemptions or preferential treatment to any parties expressing an interest. NHS England will not be liable for costs incurred by any interested party in participating in this exercise.
Interested providers will be able to view this engagement notice via the “current tenders” list on in-tend. https://in-tendhost.co.uk/scwcsu/aspx/Home
Or you should be able to go directly to this particular notice by following the link below:
In order to return the questionnaire, you will need to “express an interest” and register on the system and then upload the completed questionnaire to the placeholder provided.
On registration, please include at least 2 contacts to allow for access to the portal in times of absence.
